feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Analytics Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP Analytics Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: You have used up 90.50% of your data change log capacity for model "FPLA_PACPLAN"
entry.content: Hi Any idea why many have got this mail alert, any action required ? Thanks

entry.title: Issue with IF() syntax in SAC Grid Table formula
entry.content:
Hi ,

I'm trying to use an IF() statement in a Grid Table formula in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) to avoid division by zero when calculating variance. The platform accepts a simple formula like:

(F3 - E3) / E3

But when I try to use:

IF(E3 = 0, NULL, (F3 - E3) / E3)

I get a syntax error. I’ve tested other variations like:

  • IF(E3 <> 0, (F3 - E3) / E3, NULL)
  • IF(ISNULL(E3), NULL, (F3 - E3) / E3)

None of them work in the Grid Table context.

ps : I'm not using a calculated measure or story formula—this is directly in a Grid Table cell.

Is IF() not supported in Grid Table formulas?\ Where can I find official documentation listing supported functions in this context?

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: own map layouts and present them in the Geo Map widget in SAC
entry.content: How can I create my own map layouts and present them in the Geo Map widget? Will it work on the Optimized Design View with live connection SAP Hana On-Premise?

entry.title: Integrated Financial Planning CAPEX Delta Planning Data Action
entry.content:
Hello All,

Could anyone please help me with this? I’m reviewing the standard code for the data action Delta Planning in CAPEX. While executing the first part of the code using trace points/debugging, I’m unable to understand the logic behind the value that appears in the AMOUNT_DELTA measure (750).

Can someone assist me in figuring out how this value is being derived?

this is the logic I am debugging in standard code of calculating depreciation delta amount 

//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
//Set Configurations Definitions for the Advanced Formulas.
//------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
CONFIG.HIERARCHY.INCLUDE_MEMBERS_NOT_IN_HIERARCHY = [d/SAP_ALL_COMPANY_CODE], [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT], [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER], [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_PROFITCENTER]
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
//The data region against which the formulas will be executed.
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
MEMBERSET [d/Measures] = "AMOUNT_DELTA"
MEMBERSET [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/StartDate] TO [d/Version].[p/EndDate]
VARIABLEMEMBER #RESIDUAL_VALUE OF [d/Measures]
VARIABLEMEMBER #CUMMUL_VALUE OF [d/Measures]
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
//Calculation and Data Writing
//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
//FOREACH [d/Date]
// Staight-Line Depreciation Method: Cummulative Acquisition Value * Depriciation Percentage / 12 Periods
IF RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "DEPR_METHOD", [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/StartDate], [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER] = "#") = 1 THEN
DATA([d/Measures] = "AMOUNT_DELTA",[d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT] = [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT].[p/DepreciationAccount]) =
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #CUMMUL_VALUE, [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(1)) *
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "DEPR_PERCENTAGE", [d/Date] = [d/Version].[p/StartDate], [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER] = "#") / 12
ENDIF

entry.title: Data Mismatch Issue in SAC Story after Import from File Server
entry.content:
I have built a story in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) using an Analytic Model. The source data is coming from a file server through the SAP system. I have also applied some basic transformations before loading the data and running the import.

However, the issue is that the data displayed in my SAC report does not exactly match the data I loaded. Additionally, there are some public dimensions defined, and their mapping has already been set in the import section of the data.

Could you please guide me on why the data mismatch is occurring and how I can ensure that the SAC report reflects the exact loaded data?

entry.title: Export users from SAC tenant
entry.content:
Hi everybody,

would like to know if there is a way to export users from IAS and identify which ones are synced in SAC.

There is already a feature to export users but the fields inside the report are not relevant or identifiers of SAC tenant and there is no KBA explaining or denying this is possible.

Has someone manage to do it?

Thanks!

entry.title: SAC OAuth Client cannot read all files in filerespository
entry.content:
Dear Community,

I'm using the filerepository API (/api/v1/filerepository/Resources) to retrieve information about our content in SAC. During development I found out, that the OAuth Client cannot read files where "All users" don't have view access. I would have assumed that an OAuth Client for API usage would have access to all files?

When using the /api/v1/Resources API this OAuth client can even read stories from private folders, so the user has definitely enhanced privileges. However, the Resources API only reads stories, but we also want to retrieve resource from resourceType=ANALYSIS_WORKBOOK.

How can we give the OAuth Client access to all files (or add it to our team for administrators, so it can find all files)?

Best regards,
Harald

entry.title: SAC - Linking multiple models
entry.content:
Can you please let me know how can we implement a story from 4 BW Queries. 

I think using Link Dimensions option we can create 4 models and use them. but after linking how can we get all measures and dimensions from all models. Please provide the suggestion. Thanks

entry.title: week over week report in SAP analytics cloud
entry.content:
Hi,

I want to develop a story in SAC that displays measures week over week.

                                                                                              prev week             current week               WOW        

measure 1                                                                           1000                          1500                           50%

measure 2                                                                            800                          1000                             25%

 

There seems to be nothing inbuilt in SAC story to display week over week aggregates. Please let me know a week over week report can be developed in SAC.

entry.title: How to automate "exclude member" in tables
entry.content:
Dear All, I'm looking for a solution related to SAC table in stories.

We have some technical members in rows that are needed for calculations, but we don't want them to be visible in the table. I use "Exclude Member" option, but every time there's an update in the table, for example new dimension, the technical members occur again and I need to manually exclude them again.

Is there any option to use scrypting to exclude them on.click?

Excluding those items with filters works only with flat presentation, but we have hierarchies used in the tables.

Any advise will be appreciated. Thank you.

entry.title: Enable Now Data Integration into SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Greetings Community!

Currently, I manually transfer content data from SAP Enable Now, cloud edition  (SEN) to SAP Analytics Cloud  (SAC) each month using Excel, for review purposes. While SEN documentation indicates that data can be integrated into Microsoft Power BI, I have not found information regarding integration with SAC

Is there a way to establish a direct connection between SEN and SAC to ensure continuous and accurate data synchronization, eliminating the need for manual uploads? Thanks for any insight!

Best,

Andrew

entry.title: SAC Advanced Formula Calculate with first of each month
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

For my planning scenario, I have two data models with different levels of date granularity.

1. Calculate product costs (date granularity: monthly).
2. Calculate profitability (date granularity: day).

When copying the calculated product costs from the first data model, I select the option to write the prices to the first element of each period. For example, the price from 25 September is copied to 1 September 2025.

However, I am now facing a problem when calculating the revenue. The quantities are planned at a daily level. Therefore, revenue is only calculated correctly on the first day of the month, as this is where the price was copied to.

I can think of two ways to solve this problem:

1. Copy the price from the 1^(st) of the month to each day in the current month.
2. Calculate the revenue by referencing the price on the 1st of each month.

I tried to create a data action for the second option using the FIRST() function. Unfortunately, this function returns the first day of the year, not of each month.

CONFIG.HIERARCHY.INCLUDE_MEMBERS_NOT_IN_HIERARCHY = [d/Funktionsbereich] , [d/Sachkonto], [d/Kostenart], [d/Kunde],[d/CCW_Material], [d/Vertriebsweg], [d/Buchungskreis], [d/Profitcenter], [d/Sparte],[d/Verkaufsorganisation]

VARIABLEMEMBER #MENGE OF [d/Measures]

DATA([d/Measures] = #MENGE, [d/Funktionsbereich] = "#", [d/Sachkonto] = "#", [d/Profitcenter] = "#", [d/Sparte] = "#", [d/Kostenart] = "#") = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "Menge_ST")
// Herstellkosten = Menge * Materialkosten
IF [d/Funktionsbereich] = BASEMEMBER([d/Funktionsbereich] , "Z0100") 
	OR [d/Funktionsbereich] =BASEMEMBER([d/Funktionsbereich] , "Z0120")
	OR [d/Funktionsbereich] =BASEMEMBER([d/Funktionsbereich] , "Z0110")
	OR [d/Funktionsbereich] =BASEMEMBER([d/Funktionsbereich] , "Z0300")
	OR [d/Funktionsbereich] =BASEMEMBER([d/Funktionsbereich] , "Z0301")
	OR [d/Funktionsbereich] =BASEMEMBER([d/Funktionsbereich] , "Z0140")
	OR [d/Funktionsbereich] =BASEMEMBER([d/Funktionsbereich] , "Z0130")
THEN
	FOREACH [d/Datum]
	DELETE([d/Measures] = "Umsatz")
	DATA([d/Measures] = "Umsatz", [d/Kostenart]= "#") = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #MENGE, [d/Funktionsbereich] = "#", [d/Sachkonto] = "#", [d/Kostenart] = "#")
	* RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "Preis", [d/Kunde] = "#", [d/Datum] = FIRST([d/Datum].[p/CALMONTH]), [d/Profitcenter] = "#", [d/Sparte] = "#",[d/Sachkonto] = "#")*-1
	ENDFOR
ENDIF

Does anyone have a solution for this?
I am grateful for any assistance. Thank you in advance.

entry.title: Geographical dimensions and hierarchies in new SAC datamodels
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am simply looking to understand them when importing a local Excel file for now.

My main interrogation is about the geographical dimensions. With the classic model, you simply had to click the icon 'Geo enrichment', then choose Coordinates or Area Name, then select the corresponding columns, and you basically had your geographical dimension.

In the new model, the only way I found to do this is by adding the properties 'Latitude' and 'Longitude', to the dimension, which automatically creates a dimension table, and transforms it into a valid geographical dimension.

The first question : Is that the only way to do it in the new type of model ?

So now I have my cities geo enriched with the coordinates, but I would like to add a hierarchy on top of that, to maybe be able to dig in a geo map. (Go from continent, to country, to city for instance)

I can't figure out how to do this right now, do I have to create the hierarchy before ? But then I can't create the dimension table necessary for the coordinates.

My second question would be : Is it possible to have a geographical dimension with a level-hierarchy in the new models ?

I am just trying to make sure I did not miss some new functionnality.

Have a great day !

Off course, I have other Date filter for Year in story.

 

Regards,

Vasu

entry.title: SAC - table title mirrored to the next cell
entry.content:
Hi,

I have this table that i created with a title.

For some reason, when i copy the text to the table title, this text is mirrored to the next line like this:

If i just type the title, this doesn't happen.

The problem is that once i have this text mirrored inside the cell below, i cannot remove it anymore.

Is there a way to remove it directly without creating a new table from scratch?

Appreciate your help in advance.

entry.title: SAC Key User rights with other View reporting rights
entry.content:
Hi,

We have enabled Key User rights in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) for selected users, allowing them to create their own stories within designated folders (e.g., Folder A and Folder B in our example).

Our SAC environment primarily uses live data models, which means roles based on import models are not applicable.

In our current setup:

  • The user has view access to Report A (based on Model A).
  • The same user has Key User rights for Report B (based on Model B), enabling them to create additional stories based on Model B within Folder B.

However, since the user also has Key User rights and view access to Model A, we’ve observed that they are able to create stories based on Model A within Folder B—which is not intended.

We would like to know if there is a way to restrict story creation in Folder B to only those based on Model B, even though the user has access to other models.

Thank you!

entry.title: Widget is visible in ppt export even when made invisible
entry.content:
Hello SAC experts,

I would like to export a SAC story into PPT in a certain layout, which includes only widget required for the export. This means I would like to remove certain widgets before exporting to PPT.

I have created a button, which makes unwanted widgets invisible:  xxx.setVisible(false). When I export the story in PPT format, it exports all widgets independent on value of this parameter (all widgets are visible). The same behavior is when using the standard PPF export or "Export To PPTX". Unfortunately "Export To PPTX" does not offer the option to chose the widgets as in ExportToPDF. Can you please advice, how to adapt a story into a print version without creating a separate story with the print specific layout?

Thank you.
